db:abstract.db:para: The QScriptValueIterator class provides a Java-style iterator for QScriptValue.
This class was introduced in Qt 4.3.

db:listitem.db:para: QScriptValueIterator is part of Scripting Classes and Overviews

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: The QScriptValueIterator constructor takes a QScriptValue as argument. After construction, the iterator is located at the very beginning of the sequence of properties. Here's how to iterate over all the properties of a QScriptValue:
The next() advances the iterator. The name(), value() and flags() functions return the name, value and flags of the last item that was jumped over.
If you want to remove properties as you iterate over the QScriptValue, use remove(). If you want to modify the value of a property, use setValue().
Note that QScriptValueIterator only iterates over the QScriptValue's own properties; i.e. it does not follow the prototype chain. You can use a loop like this to follow the prototype chain:

Note that QScriptValueIterator will not automatically skip over properties that have the QScriptValue::SkipInEnumeration flag set; that flag only affects iteration in script code. If you want, you can skip over such properties with code like the following:

db:section.db:title: QScriptValueIterator::QScriptValueIterator(const QScriptValue &object)
db:section.db:para: Constructs an iterator for traversing object. The iterator is set to be at the front of the sequence of properties (before the first property).

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] QScriptValueIterator::~QScriptValueIterator()
db:section.db:para: Destroys the iterator.

db:section.db:title: QScriptValue::PropertyFlags QScriptValueIterator::flags() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the flags of the last property that was jumped over using next() or previous().

db:section.db:title: bool QScriptValueIterator::hasNext() const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if there is at least one item ahead of the iterator (i.e. the iterator is not at the back of the property sequence); otherwise returns false.

db:section.db:title: bool QScriptValueIterator::hasPrevious() const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if there is at least one item behind the iterator (i.e. the iterator is not at the front of the property sequence); otherwise returns false.

db:section.db:title: QString QScriptValueIterator::name() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the name of the last property that was jumped over using next() or previous().

db:section.db:title: void QScriptValueIterator::next()
db:section.db:para: Advances the iterator by one position.
Calling this function on an iterator located at the back of the container leads to undefined results.

db:section.db:title: void QScriptValueIterator::previous()
db:section.db:para: Moves the iterator back by one position.
Calling this function on an iterator located at the front of the container leads to undefined results.

db:section.db:title: void QScriptValueIterator::remove()
db:section.db:para: Removes the last property that was jumped over using next() or previous().

db:section.db:title: [since 4.4] QScriptString QScriptValueIterator::scriptName() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the name of the last property that was jumped over using next() or previous().
This function was introduced in Qt 4.4.

db:section.db:title: void QScriptValueIterator::setValue(const QScriptValue &value)
db:section.db:para: Sets the value of the last property that was jumped over using next() or previous().

db:section.db:title: void QScriptValueIterator::toBack()
db:section.db:para: Moves the iterator to the back of the QScriptValue (after the last property).

db:section.db:title: void QScriptValueIterator::toFront()
db:section.db:para: Moves the iterator to the front of the QScriptValue (before the first property).

db:section.db:title: QScriptValue QScriptValueIterator::value() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the value of the last property that was jumped over using next() or previous().

db:section.db:title: QScriptValueIterator &QScriptValueIterator::operator=(QScriptValue &object)
db:section.db:para: Makes the iterator operate on object. The iterator is set to be at the front of the sequence of properties (before the first property).
